alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 6:06PM CDT until July 14 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Wayne County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 1215 AM CDT Thursday. * At 606 PM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall and flooding in the city of Waynesboro. Rainfall amounts in excess of 2 inches may fall in a short period of time with this storm. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waynesboro, West King, Woodwards, Boice, Hiwannee, Whistler, Winchester, Denham, Gretna and Eucutta. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
